big_picture_notes: Mark’s fast‑paced Gospel (driven by euthys/‘immediately’) unfolds in two movements: Galilean power and revelation (1:1–8:26) and the way to the cross (8:27–16:8). Literary glue includes the Messianic Secret, intercalation (‘sandwiches’), and escalating conflict leading to the Passion. The hinge is Peter’s confession (8:27–30).
